_header: It is full hard to know any estate
Note: Immediately preceded by Lydgate’s Horse Sheep & Goose (1075) in this MS only, and followed by 5534; St 6= st. 23 of 5788; st. 7 = st. 1 of 5410 and = 5411.
Subjects: proverbs; abuses of the age; mutability
_description: Proverbial verses showing the influence of Cato’s ‘Distiches’ — in rhyme royal stanzas.

HunHM144.First Lines:
Hit is ful harde to knowe ony estateDouble visage loketh oute of
                    euery hood…
HunHM144.Last Lines:
…Hurte not thy self lest thou sore reweffor thyn owne ese
                    keepe thy tonge in mewe
HunHM144.Note:
Followed immediately by 5534 and 5411, as if part of same text; 5 x RR; added modern
                    note, ‘On Conduct & Manners, Misrule & Good Rule in’ (f.
                    145); 5 stanzas copied from Caxton.
